body:
I plan to add some instance methods to `SendCoinsRecipient` in an upcoming PR, so this might be a good time to give it its own file.

I couldn't figure out how to move `inline void SerializationOp` to the `.cpp` file without getting errors like:

```
  CXX      qt/qt_libbitcoinqt_a-sendcoinsrecipient.o
qt/sendcoinsrecipient.cpp:7:37: error: unknown type name 'Stream'
SendCoinsRecipient::SerializationOp(Stream& s, Operation ser_action)
                                    ^
```

Although I haven't found any bugs (yet), the following warning is probably not good:

```
  AR       qt/libbitcoinqt.a
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: qt/libbitcoinqt.a(qt_libbitcoinqt_a-moc_sendcoinsrecipient.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: qt/libbitcoinqt.a(qt_libbitcoinqt_a-moc_sendcoinsrecipient.o) has no symbols
  OBJCXXLD qt/bitcoin-qt
```
title: [qt] move SendCoinsRecipient to its own file
